title: A-Trak's 'In My Feelings' Is a Summer Bop You Need in Your Life
summary: The Shiggy dance craze is based on a single dance move, based on the lift-up-one-foot-and-hop-on-the-other-foot move. The dance is easy to learn, requires no real skill and can be silly and ridiculous. Celebrities from Cardi B to Will Smith have been dancing to this silly song. It's a great excuse to get out of your house and enjoy some fresh air, too. It is also a way to embrace your creativity and show off your personality.

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("h2",null,"What you need to know about the Shiggy"),mdx("p",null,`The first thing you need to know about the Shiggy is that it is named after Shiggy. Who is Shiggy? Shiggy is a comedian who found fame on Instagram for his hilarious videos. Shiggy used to be a dancer, and he can still be seen on Instagram dancing with his shirt off.
For this dance craze, people are referring to his viral dance in the \u201CIn My Feelings\u201D music video. He is the guy who climbs out of a window, grabs onto a branch and then launches back into the house while Drake raps, \u201CKeke, do you love me?\u201D
The Internet is always up for being silly and having a good laugh, and Shiggy\u2019s hilarious dance is the perfect material for such shenanigans.`),mdx("h2",null,"How to do it: The Shiggy Dance Breakdown"),mdx("p",null,`The Shiggy dance is actually very simple. All you do is get out of your car and lift up one of your feet while keeping the other planted firmly on the ground. Then, while keeping your head down and your eyes on the planted foot, you hop on your lifted foot. Hop back down. Then hop back up again. It is that simple.
In the \u201CIn My Feelings\u201D music video, Shiggy\u2019s dance is actually more complex than that. He does the simple lift-up-one-foot-and-hop-on-the-other-foot move, but he also does some sort of leg flailing that makes the dance a little more hectic.`),mdx("h2",null,"So why is everyone so crazy about this dance?"),mdx("p",null,`The Shiggy dance craze is the perfect storm of silly, light-hearted fun. It is easy for anyone to do and doesn\u2019t require any real skill or athleticism. Basically, anyone can do it.
It is just so bizarre, too. No one really knows what they are doing while they do it. Plus, it is super silly. What is probably most impressive is that this whole social media craze is based on a single dance move. But it really is just one move.
The Shiggy dance is easy to learn, requires no real skill and can be silly and ridiculous. There are few other things that can be as fun as this dance.`),mdx("h2",null,"But why should you care about the Shiggy?"),mdx("p",null,`The Shiggy is basically a silly dance craze that is taking over the Internet. Celebrities are getting in on it, too. Everyone from Cardi B to Will Smith has been dancing to this silly song.
But the Shiggy dance is more than just a silly dance craze. It is also a way to embrace your creativity and show off your personality. You can make this dance as silly or as serious as you want. You can do it in public or in your living room. You can do it by yourself or with your friends.
You can even make up your own moves. The dance is a blank slate for you to do whatever you want with it.
It\u2019s a fantastic way to express yourself and have a good time with friends, family and anyone else who is silly enough to join in.`),mdx("h2",null,"Why are people participating in the Shiggy Challenge?"),mdx("p",null,`This is a big question, and it may have no single answer. The Shiggy challenge is silly, fun and a great excuse to get out of your house and enjoy some fresh air. It is a great way to get some exercise, too.
We are living in a time when social media is increasingly taking over our lives. We are always looking at our phones and computers, and we are making new friends online and shunning friendship in real life.
But the Shiggy Challenge is bringing people back together again. It is getting people out of their houses and out of their phones. It is getting people to interact with each other.
You don\u2019t need to be famous or rich to participate in the Shiggy challenge. Anyone can do it, and anyone can join in on the fun.`),mdx("h2",null,"Final thoughts"),mdx("p",null,`The Shiggy is silly, fun and a great way to express yourself. You can do it with friends, family or even by yourself. It is a fantastic way to be creative and have a good time with people you care about.
It is a great way to get people together and enjoying the company of others. It is a great way to get people out of their houses and off their phones. It is a great way to enjoy life again.
So if you haven\u2019t already, hop out of your window, grab onto a branch and launch back in. It is time to embrace your creativity and have a good time with your friends and family.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Whiplash" Is a Tense and Exhilarating Look at the World of Jazz
"The Martian" Is a Triumph of Science Fiction

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`Ridley Scott\u2019s new movie, The Martian, is based on a novel of the same name by Andy Weir. It\u2019s about an astronaut called Mark Watney who gets stranded on Mars after his crewmates think he\u2019s dead and leave without him. This might seem as just another case of annoying Hollywood over-simplification: after all, we get so many bioengineered super-geniuses with computer uplink implants that they can become trapped in remote locations via their own stupidity. But there\u2019s more to it than that.
In both book and film, the humanity of Watney comes out in everything he does to survive: logical thinking (how can I eat this potato again?), ingenuity (I need water; how do I distill it from our CO2 filters), courage (explore the abandoned outpost), and compassion (contact my family). He also has a lot of fun with his predicament, cracking jokes through his video log and even going disco.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

relatedArticles.title: "Bridge of Spies" Is a Masterful Cold War Thriller

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...o}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...o,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`With the specter of mutually assured destruction looming over every global crisis and proxy conflict, the Cold War is perhaps one of the most fraught periods in history. There are no heroes in this period\u2014just two paranoid superpowers scrambling to maintain the upper hand, irrespective of cost. The inherent darkness and moral ambiguity of that period makes for fantastic fodder for any storyteller looking to immerse their audience in a stark world where there are no easy answers.
The 1980s was a peak moment in that tension\u2014from Reagan\u2019s \u201Cevil empire\u201D speech and constant saber-rattling, to the U.S.-backed Contra War against Communist rebels in Nicaragua and an escalation of tensions between NATO and the USSR all around the globe. In brief: It was not a good time to be alive if you believed in world peace. Thankfully, Hollywood had spies as intrepid as Tom Hanks ready to leap into action against those dastardly Soviet Commies whenever they needed someone captured or rescued from behind enemy lines.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...a}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...a,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`While there has been some great music released this year, the first half of 2018 has not been an exceptional one for new releases. However, that doesn\u2019t mean there hasn\u2019t been some brilliant albums released so far this year. While last year had some incredible albums (like Kendrick Lamar\u2019s \u201CDamn,\u201D Lorde\u2019s \u201CMelodrama,\u201D and Noel Gallagher\u2019s High Flying Birds' "Who Built the Moon?"), this year hasn\u2019t quite matched up to those standards. However, we are only halfway through the year and as such, we have also seen some fantastic new albums released in the last few months that are worth mentioning. There may not be many great new albums out at the moment \u2013 but these five are definitely among the best.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;

"The Big Short" Is a Searing Indictment of the Financial Industry

intro.compiledSource:
const layoutProps={},MDXLayout="wrapper";function MDXContent({components:e,...t}){return mdx(MDXLayout,{...layoutProps,...t,components:e,mdxType:"MDXLayout"},mdx("p",null,`The film version of The Big Short hits theaters this Friday, and it\u2019s not subtle. Its tagline is \u201CThere\u2019s a sucker born every minute. But they don\u2019t grow up thinking they can be con men. They get taught to be one.\u201D And its trailer goes on to say, \u201CThe housing bubble was about to burst\u2026 And a group of misfits saw it coming. Now these unlikely heroes must band together and bring down the greedy villains who crashed the world economy\u2026 Before anyone else gets hurt.\u201D
Unfortunately, that last part is not hyperbole. The actions of unscrupulous financial engineers \u2014 colloquially known as \u201Cbankers\u201D \u2014 led directly to the Great Recession in 2008, which cost millions their jobs and homes, while triggering widespread deflation and anemic growth throughout much of the developed world for years thereafter.`))}MDXContent.isMDXComponent=!0;
